Operations Bulletin
Endorsed by IATA Technical Fuel Group
Bulletin 161
Hose Safety Awareness - Trelleborg AEROKLER C & CT DN100
December 2025

Introduction
This bulletin addresses critical safety concerns regarding Trelleborg AEROKLER C & CT DN100 hoses manufactured before Q4 2025. All affected hoses must be identified, inspected, and withdrawn from service by 31 December 2025.

Affected Products
- Trelleborg AEROKLER C DN100 (4-inch) hoses
- Trelleborg AEROKLER CT DN100 (4-inch) hoses
- Manufactured before Q4 2025
- All locations using these hoses for aviation fuel operations

Immediate Actions Required
1. Inventory & Identification: All affected hoses must be identified and listed in your inventory system immediately.
2. Weekly Inspections: Increase inspection frequency from monthly to weekly until replacements are completed.
3. Withdrawal Schedule: Develop and implement a withdrawal schedule to meet the 31/12/2025 deadline.
4. Replacement Planning: Initiate procurement of new, reinforced hoses as replacements.

Inventory & Identification Requirements

All operators must:
- Conduct a complete inventory of all 4-inch Trelleborg AEROKLER C & CT DN100 hoses
- Verify manufacturing dates and serial numbers
- Create a comprehensive list of affected hoses
- Document hose locations, installation dates, and current condition
- Update inventory systems with identification markers
- Cross-reference with purchase records and maintenance logs

Identification Process:
1. Review all hose purchase records from Trelleborg
2. Inspect physical hoses for model identification (AEROKLER C or CT DN100)
3. Check manufacturing date codes on hose labels
4. Verify hose diameter (must be 4-inch/DN100)
5. Document all findings in inventory management system

Deadline: Complete identification within 30 days of bulletin receipt.

Withdrawal from Service

All affected Trelleborg AEROKLER C & CT DN100 hoses manufactured before Q4 2025 must be withdrawn from service no later than 31 December 2025.

Withdrawal Process:
1. Schedule withdrawal based on replacement availability
2. Tag affected hoses with withdrawal notice
3. Remove from active service immediately upon replacement
4. Document withdrawal date and reason
5. Store withdrawn hoses separately pending disposal
6. Update maintenance records and inventory systems

Critical Timeline:
- Final removal deadline: 31/12/2025
- No extensions permitted
- All affected hoses must be out of service by this date
- Replacement hoses must be installed and tested before withdrawal

Compliance:
Failure to meet the withdrawal deadline may result in non-compliance with JIG standards and potential safety risks.

Replacement Planning

Operators must develop and implement a comprehensive replacement plan:

1. Procurement:
   - Contact regional Trelleborg representative for replacement hoses
   - Order new, reinforced hoses meeting current specifications
   - Ensure adequate lead time for delivery
   - Verify new hoses are manufactured Q4 2025 or later

2. Soak Testing:
   - All replacement hoses must undergo soak testing before installation
   - Follow JIG 1 Appendix A7.1 procedures for soak testing
   - Document all test results
   - Maintain test certificates

3. Installation:
   - Install replacement hoses according to manufacturer specifications
   - Conduct pressure testing after installation
   - Verify proper connections and fittings
   - Update installation records

4. Timeline:
   - Complete procurement within 60 days
   - Finish soak testing within 90 days
   - Complete installation before 31/12/2025 withdrawal deadline

Weekly Inspection Implementation

Due to the safety concerns identified, all affected hoses must be inspected weekly instead of the previous monthly frequency.

Inspection Requirements:
- Frequency: Weekly (every 7 days)
- Effective immediately upon bulletin receipt
- Continue until all affected hoses are replaced
- Inspect all Trelleborg AEROKLER C & CT DN100 hoses manufactured before Q4 2025

Inspection Checklist:
1. Visual inspection for cracks, cuts, or abrasions
2. Check for signs of degradation or wear
3. Verify hose connections and fittings are secure
4. Inspect for fuel leaks or seepage
5. Check hose routing and support
6. Verify proper labeling and identification
7. Document all findings in inspection records

Inspection Records:
- Maintain detailed records of all weekly inspections
- Include date, inspector name, hose identification, findings
- Review records regularly for compliance
- Flag any anomalies or concerns immediately
- Keep records available for audit purposes

Inspection Records Management

All weekly inspection records must be maintained and reviewed:

Record Requirements:
- Date and time of inspection
- Inspector name and qualifications
- Hose identification (serial number, location)
- Visual findings and observations
- Any anomalies or concerns identified
- Actions taken (if any)
- Next inspection due date

Record Review:
- Conduct weekly review of inspection records
- Identify trends or recurring issues
- Ensure compliance with inspection frequency
- Verify all affected hoses are being inspected
- Flag any missed inspections immediately

Compliance Monitoring:
- Regular audits of inspection records
- Cross-reference with hose inventory
- Verify all affected hoses have current inspection records
- Identify gaps in inspection coverage
- Ensure early detection of potential issues

Documentation Standards:
- Use standardized inspection forms
- Maintain digital records where possible
- Keep physical copies as backup
- Ensure records are accessible for audits
- Archive records according to retention policies

Communication with Trelleborg

All operators must establish contact with their regional Trelleborg representative:

Contact Requirements:
- Reach out to regional Trelleborg representative immediately
- Arrange for replacement hose procurement
- Clarify technical specifications for new hoses
- Discuss delivery timelines and availability
- Address any questions about hose compatibility
- Obtain updated installation instructions if needed

Technical Clarifications:
- Verify new hose specifications meet current requirements
- Confirm manufacturing date requirements (Q4 2025 or later)
- Discuss soak testing requirements
- Clarify installation procedures
- Address any compatibility concerns
- Obtain technical support documentation

Procurement Coordination:
- Place orders for replacement hoses
- Coordinate delivery schedules
- Arrange for technical support if needed
- Ensure adequate quantities for replacement
- Plan for spare hoses if required

Regional Contacts:
- Contact information available through Trelleborg website
- Regional representatives assigned by geographic area
- Technical support available for installation questions
- Emergency contacts for urgent issues

Staff Awareness & Training

All relevant operational and maintenance staff must be informed and trained:

Training Requirements:
- Inform all staff about the bulletin immediately
- Conduct training sessions on new inspection frequency
- Explain the stop-of-use directive and timeline
- Train staff on identification of affected hoses
- Provide guidance on inspection procedures
- Review withdrawal and replacement procedures

Staff Categories:
- Maintenance technicians
- Operations personnel
- Fuel handling staff
- Safety officers
- Supervisors and managers
- Quality assurance staff

Training Topics:
1. Identification of affected hoses (Trelleborg AEROKLER C & CT DN100)
2. Weekly inspection procedures and checklist
3. Documentation requirements
4. Withdrawal procedures and timeline
5. Replacement installation process
6. Incident reporting procedures
7. Compliance requirements

Training Records:
- Document all training sessions
- Maintain attendance records
- Verify staff comprehension
- Provide refresher training as needed
- Keep training records for audit purposes

Incident Reporting

Any incidents or findings related to hose integrity or fuel containment must be reported:

Reporting Requirements:
- Report immediately to JIG (Joint Inspection Group)
- Notify Trelleborg of any incidents
- Document all findings in detail
- Include photos or evidence if available
- Provide hose identification and location
- Describe circumstances and impact

Reportable Incidents:
- Fuel leaks from affected hoses
- Hose failures or ruptures
- Degradation or wear beyond normal
- Safety concerns identified during inspection
- Any anomalies related to hose integrity
- Fuel containment issues

Reporting Channels:
- JIG: Submit through standard incident reporting system
- Trelleborg: Contact regional representative
- Internal: Follow company incident reporting procedures
- Regulatory: Report to relevant aviation authorities if required

Report Content:
- Date and time of incident
- Location and hose identification
- Description of incident or finding
- Immediate actions taken
- Impact assessment
- Photos or documentation
- Follow-up actions planned

Compliance with JIG Standards

All actions must comply with:
- JIG 1 Appendix A7.1: Equipment and Facilities Standards
- JIG 2 Appendix A6.1: Operations and Maintenance Standards

JIG 1 Appendix A7.1 Requirements:
- Hose specifications and standards
- Equipment testing requirements
- Soak testing procedures
- Installation standards
- Maintenance and inspection requirements

JIG 2 Appendix A6.1 Requirements:
- Operational procedures
- Maintenance schedules
- Inspection frequencies
- Documentation standards
- Compliance monitoring

Compliance Review:
- Conduct regular compliance reviews
- Verify all actions meet JIG standards
- Document compliance evidence
- Address any non-compliance immediately
- Maintain compliance records
- Prepare for audits

Audit Readiness:
- Ensure all documentation is current
- Verify compliance with all requirements
- Maintain organized records
- Prepare for regulatory reviews
- Address any audit findings promptly

Documentation & Audit Readiness

All documentation must be maintained and kept current:

Required Documentation:
- Hose inventory and identification records
- Withdrawal schedules and completion records
- Replacement procurement documentation
- Soak testing certificates and results
- Installation records and test results
- Weekly inspection records
- Training records and attendance
- Incident reports (if any)
- Communication records with Trelleborg
- Compliance review documentation

Documentation Standards:
- Maintain accurate and current records
- Use standardized forms and formats
- Ensure proper organization and filing
- Keep digital and physical copies
- Maintain proper version control
- Archive according to retention policies

Audit Preparation:
- Organize all documentation systematically
- Ensure easy access and retrieval
- Verify completeness of records
- Prepare summary reports
- Address any gaps or deficiencies
- Maintain audit trail

Regulatory Review:
- Ensure documentation meets regulatory requirements
- Prepare for inspections and audits
- Maintain records for required retention periods
- Provide documentation upon request
- Demonstrate compliance with all requirements

Review of Previous Bulletins

Operators should review previous JIG bulletins and safety communications:

Relevant Previous Bulletins:
- Bulletin 87: Core Principles Annual Review (2015)
- Bulletin 100: Underwing Refueling Nozzles - Cotter Pin Issues
- Bulletin 102: Filter Water Separators (EI 1581 6th Edition)
- Various safety communications regarding hose integrity

Historical Context:
- Previous incidents related to hose failures
- Recommendations for enhanced inspection procedures
- Lessons learned from similar safety issues
- Best practices developed over time

Review Process:
1. Identify relevant previous bulletins
2. Review recommendations and actions
3. Assess applicability to current situation
4. Incorporate lessons learned into procedures
5. Update maintenance and safety procedures
6. Document review findings

Incorporation into Procedures:
- Update maintenance procedures based on lessons learned
- Enhance inspection checklists
- Improve documentation requirements
- Strengthen training programs
- Refine incident reporting processes
- Update compliance monitoring

Continuous Improvement:
- Learn from historical incidents
- Apply best practices
- Update procedures regularly
- Share lessons learned
- Maintain awareness of safety trends
